KH.content: [re: inevitable anachronism, teleological retrospection, of translating khōra] Heidegger falls prey in spite of himself [see p. 147n Heidegger: Platonic philosophy prepared move from khōra and Ort (place, topos) to “space (Raum)” defined by extension (Ausdehnung)]

GOD.linkedContent: Heidegger doesn’t refer to infinite love to discuss primary guilt (Schuldigsein)

GT.linkedContent: relation of gift to “present,” essential knot in interlace of this discourse [GT], in knot of Geflecht of which Heidegger says the circle is perhaps only one figure/particular case

GT.linkedContent: temporalization of time (memory, present, anticipation, pro, re-tention, imminence of future, “ecstases”) destroys the gift via keeping (la garde), restitution, comprehending in advance

GT.content: for Heidegger, importance of rethinking time, privileged horizon for reelaboration of Being

GT.content: “it gives (ça donne),” not an utterance in propositional structure of Greek-Latin grammar

R.linkedContent: Derrida loves the image of the wheel (potter) [Heidegger’s Das Ding?]

R.content: salut: retten, heilen, grüssen…btwn salvation and salute to the other
R.linkedContent: salut: retten, heilen, grüssen…btwn salvation and salute to the other

MONL.content: Derrida sounds very Heideggerian [?]: appeal to come (appel à venir) gathers language together…
MONL.linkedContent: Derrida sounds very Heideggerian [?]: appeal to come (appel à venir) gathers language together…

MONL.content: Heidegger says [?], “there is language that does not exist,” i.e. there is no metalanguage

OOG.content: Derrida asks: why would there be any history instead of nothing?
OOG.linkedContent: Derrida asks: why would there be any history instead of nothing?

FK.linkedContent: Heidegger’s rehearsal of and hollowing out of Christian motifs: Schuldigsein, Bezeugung, Gewissen

FK.content: Heidegger on Hölderlin: sacred of poetic only opens time of apparition of the gods, is divine, does not dream a god
FK.linkedContent: Heidegger on Hölderlin: sacred of poetic only opens time of apparition of the gods, is divine, does not dream a god

FK.linkedContent: Heidegger would’ve reduced the debate over “return of religious” to dominant juridical system to “machine age” [he cares about something else]

FK.content: testimonial, sacredness in Heidegger, Bezeugung (attestation) [see A p. 30 testify to death] ——each time Heidegger uses Faktum (not empirical fact) led back to place where acquiescence is de rigueur

FK.linkedContent: Heidegger is more resistant to belief than sacredness

FL.linkedContent: don’t confuse Heidegger’s Destruktion w/ “destruction” at heart of Benjamin’s thought, but both sought condition of an authentic tradition & memory

LOBL.linkedContent: La Chose takes place w/out having place [Introduction to Meta… & OG sent to Olivia]

LOBL.content: what is arrested here: authenticity (Eigentlichkeit) of a being-for-death
LOBL.linkedContent: what is arrested here: authenticity (Eigentlichkeit) of a being-for-death

SPOM.content: Heidegger on dikē as accord, joining, harmony (Die Fuge (joint) ist der Fug) thought on basis of presence (als Anwesen gedacht) vs. adikia as out of joint (aus der Fuge), error of stupidity
SPOM.linkedContent: Heidegger on dikē as accord, joining, harmony (Die Fuge (joint) ist der Fug) thought on basis of presence (als Anwesen gedacht) vs. adikia as out of joint (aus der Fuge), error of stupidity

SPOM.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Weile as passage, a transitory moment, time of present that comes from future to the past, toward going of gone

SPOM.content: Heidegger refuses to see nihilism in Ancient Greek thought of adikia, but a “trace” of the “tragic,” beyond esthetic-psychoanalytic, this trace calls us to thinking
SPOM.linkedContent: Heidegger refuses to see nihilism in Ancient Greek thought of adikia, but a “trace” of the “tragic,” beyond esthetic-psychoanalytic, this trace calls us to thinking

SPOM.content: Heidegger’s thought of joining, jointure, a thinking of injunction
SPOM.linkedContent: Heidegger’s thought of joining, jointure, a thinking of injunction

SPOM.content: Heidegger’s supplement of accord, giving what you don’t have (Plotinus), according presence to the other, beyond economy
SPOM.linkedContent: Heidegger’s supplement of accord, giving what you don’t have (Plotinus), according presence to the other, beyond economy

SPOM.content: [Derrida wrestles with Heidegger’s take on dikē, jointure, and its relation to adikia, disjointure or injustice, wondering if he skews the relation in favor of possibility of favor]
SPOM.linkedContent: [Derrida wrestles with Heidegger’s take on dikē, jointure, and its relation to adikia, disjointure or injustice, wondering if he skews the relation in favor of possibility of favor]

POOF.content: in its very depth the keeping silent of Sein und Zeit never laughs (hear something here re: colloquy btwn Heidegger & Nietzsche) > little room for laughter in Heidegger
POOF.linkedContent: in its very depth the keeping silent of Sein und Zeit never laughs (hear something here re: colloquy btwn Heidegger & Nietzsche) > little room for laughter in Heidegger

POOF.content: Schmitt & Heidegger give credit to oppositional logic (one Nietzsche smiles at) > Heidegger on technological deployment of modern ‘world wars,’ abandonment of Being, man as ‘most important raw material,’ lets his will be unconditionally equated w/ the process
POOF.linkedContent: Schmitt & Heidegger give credit to oppositional logic (one Nietzsche smiles at) > Heidegger on technological deployment of modern ‘world wars,’ abandonment of Being, man as ‘most important raw material,’ lets his will be unconditionally equated w/ the process

POR.content: one of Heidegger’s most insistent questions: how did the incubation of reason [starting w/ Aristotle’s “roots,” “principles,” “causes”] take until the 17<sup><small>th</small></sup> Century to become the “principle of reason”?
POR.linkedContent: one of Heidegger’s most insistent questions: how did the incubation of reason [starting w/ Aristotle’s “roots,” “principles,” “causes”] take until the 17th Century to become the “principle of reason”?

POR.content: for Heidegger, principle of reason accompanied by interpretation of essence of beings as objects, an object present as representation (Vorstellung)
POR.linkedContent: for Heidegger, principle of reason accompanied by interpretation of essence of beings as objects, an object present as representation (Vorstellung)

POR.content: principle of reason (Satz vom Grund) tells us to protect [dominant] relation of ob-ject before a subject that says “I”, and is assured of presence
POR.linkedContent: principle of reason (Satz vom Grund) tells us to protect [dominant] relation of ob-ject before a subject that says “I”, and is assured of presence

POR.content: Heidegger’s caricature of principle of reason: hard, unblinking eyes (dominating, raping)
POR.linkedContent: Heidegger’s caricature of principle of reason: hard, unblinking eyes (dominating, raping)

POR.content: Heidegger makes language do its work [re: interaction btwn begegnen, entgegen, Gegenstand and Stellen, Vorstellen, Zustellen]
POR.linkedContent: Heidegger makes language do its work [re: interaction btwn begegnen, entgegen, Gegenstand and Stellen, Vorstellen, Zustellen]

POR.content: vis-à-vis Heidegger, one can no longer distinguish btwn technology, science, theory and rationality, principle of reason cannot be separated from idea of technology [techno-science]
POR.linkedContent: vis-à-vis Heidegger, one can no longer distinguish btwn technology, science, theory and rationality, principle of reason cannot be separated from idea of technology [techno-science]

HERP.content: Heidegger mentions positively tradition of Scheler which goes back to Augustine [St. Anselm?] & Pascal: we access truth/knowledge on basis of love/charity—not vice versa
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger mentions positively tradition of Scheler which goes back to Augustine [St. Anselm?] & Pascal: we access truth/knowledge on basis of love/charity—not vice versa

HERP.content: Heidegger critiques or enacts “destruction” of Aristotle’s broken theory of logos as judgment, but remains Aristotelian when saying only Dasein can have a friend—animal has no ear
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger critiques or enacts “destruction” of Aristotle’s broken theory of logos as judgment, but remains Aristotelian when saying only Dasein can have a friend—animal has no ear

HERP.content: acc. Heidegger, philosophy addresses itself to us as a summons, we respond, in a correspondence (Entsprechen), lend an ear, w/ that toward which philosophy is underway (unterwegs)
HERP.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, philosophy addresses itself to us as a summons, we respond, in a correspondence (Entsprechen), lend an ear, w/ that toward which philosophy is underway (unterwegs)

HERP.content: deconstruction, or rather Heidegger’s Destruktion: appropriation of the tradition (while “destructing”), calls itself (heisst): “open our ear (unser Ohr öffnen)” [to a friend?]
HERP.linkedContent: deconstruction, or rather Heidegger’s Destruktion: appropriation of the tradition (while “destructing”), calls itself (heisst): “open our ear (unser Ohr öffnen)” [to a friend?]

HERP.content: caught in ring of circle once questioning philosophy, engaged by Greek tongue > acc. Heidegger, obscurely, authoritatively, Greek tongue alone is logos
HERP.linkedContent: caught in ring of circle once questioning philosophy, engaged by Greek tongue > acc. Heidegger, obscurely, authoritatively, Greek tongue alone is logos

HERP.content: where Derrida is beyond Heidegger’s aim (propos) [acc. Derrida]: in the non synonymy of dissemblance, heterogeneity, disproportion, incommensurability, nonexchange, excess of every measure/symmetry > democracy to-come
HERP.linkedContent: where Derrida is beyond Heidegger’s aim (propos) [acc. Derrida]: in the non synonymy of dissemblance, heterogeneity, disproportion, incommensurability, nonexchange, excess of every measure/symmetry > democracy to-come

HERP.content: Heidegger on “the few” [poets, philosophers…] the few who tried to save sofon from (contre) the Sophists, from men of marketplace, “to save and protect (retten und schützen)”
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger on “the few” [poets, philosophers…] the few who tried to save sofon from (contre) the Sophists, from men of marketplace, “to save and protect (retten und schützen)”

HERP.content: for Heidegger, philosophy seeks after, comes later than harmony, this delay eroticizes philosophical search, tension of Eros; Heraclitus & Parmenides not philosophers, no straining, no erotic pas, in accord, Einklang, homology w/ logos
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, philosophy seeks after, comes later than harmony, this delay eroticizes philosophical search, tension of Eros; Heraclitus & Parmenides not philosophers, no straining, no erotic pas, in accord, Einklang, homology w/ logos

HERP.content: for Heidegger, originary Eris [Derrida had just mentioned Eros] as truth of philia—Blake’s “opposition is true friendship”
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, originary Eris [Derrida had just mentioned Eros] as truth of philia—Blake’s “opposition is true friendship”

HERP.content: why striking (marquant)? because prägen (mark, strike, leave imprint) is found so frequently in Heidegger > philosophy forged, stamped (geprägt) by Heraclitus in name of gathering, gathered originarily in one striking force, one trait > Kampf
HERP.linkedContent: why striking (marquant)? because prägen (mark, strike, leave imprint) is found so frequently in Heidegger > philosophy forged, stamped (geprägt) by Heraclitus in name of gathering, gathered originarily in one striking force, one trait > Kampf

HERP.content: polemos no stranger to crossing out of being (kreuzweise Durchstreichung), participates in the play of the fourfold (earth, sky, humans, immortals)
HERP.linkedContent: polemos no stranger to crossing out of being (kreuzweise Durchstreichung), participates in the play of the fourfold (earth, sky, humans, immortals)

HERP.content: Heidegger claims that all metaphysicians (strangers to the originarity of Heraclitus’ logos) committed an anachronic anthroplogization abusively reappropriating H’s word (parole)
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger claims that all metaphysicians (strangers to the originarity of Heraclitus’ logos) committed an anachronic anthroplogization abusively reappropriating H’s word (parole)

HERP.content: Heidegger’s desire to hear better, w/ another ear, beyond consonance w/ narrow political, determined context toward horizon of a more open future
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s desire to hear better, w/ another ear, beyond consonance w/ narrow political, determined context toward horizon of a more open future

HERP.content: how is Heidegger’s monology, this belonging-to-one-another of Speech [shiz produced by polemos must gather, join up, ally, couple] different from speculative proposition [Hegel]? both synthesize an autoheterology, a heterotautology—too big of a question? [see p. 214 reconciliation in Heidegger btwn friend & enemy]
HERP.linkedContent: how is Heidegger’s monology, this belonging-to-one-another of Speech [shiz produced by polemos must gather, join up, ally, couple] different from speculative proposition [Hegel]? both synthesize an autoheterology, a heterotautology—too big of a question? [see p. 214 reconciliation in Heidegger btwn friend & enemy]

HERP.content: Heidegger’s 3 creative “Gewalten” of historial destiny: poet, thinker, statesman > their work as Schaffen carries seal or signature of originary polemos/Kampf [see p. 200]
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s 3 creative “Gewalten” of historial destiny: poet, thinker, statesman > their work as Schaffen carries seal or signature of originary polemos/Kampf [see p. 200]

HERP.content: to say “Mein Kampf” would be ridiculous presumption to Heidegger [?] or does it appeal to an originary polemos?
HERP.linkedContent: to say “Mein Kampf” would be ridiculous presumption to Heidegger [?] or does it appeal to an originary polemos?

HERP.content: for Heidgeger, phusis: instituting institution, originary upsurging of force, power, or violence, of the Gewalten des Waltenden ——acc. Heidegger, when conflict stops, when one doesn’t hear the unheard, being is no longer kept, becomes an object, a spectacle, in the quelled visibility of objects facing us

Heidegger, when conflict stops, when one doesn’t hear the unheard, being is no longer kept, becomes an object, a spectacle, in the quelled visibility of objects facing us

HERP.content: seeing a decay like that which occurs to hearing, suffers when polemos is quelled, sight degenerates into optics > creators (poets, thinkers, statesmen) are no longer tolerated [Nietzsche]
HERP.linkedContent: seeing a decay like that which occurs to hearing, suffers when polemos is quelled, sight degenerates into optics > creators (poets, thinkers, statesmen) are no longer tolerated [Nietzsche]

HERP.content: Heidegger almost never names the enemy, nor hatred, why such dissymmetry, a voice of friend in polemos, but not a voice of enemy?
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger almost never names the enemy, nor hatred, why such dissymmetry, a voice of friend in polemos, but not a voice of enemy?

HERP.content: for Heidegger, Hölderlin’s sacrifice, which Germans have not heard, is an exemplary sacrifice, but how to respond to someone who says “You do not hear the sacrificed poet”?
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Hölderlin’s sacrifice, which Germans have not heard, is an exemplary sacrifice, but how to respond to someone who says “You do not hear the sacrificed poet”?

HERP.content: can we read an “unconscious” affinity btwn impending arrival of friend and imminence of death? [Heidegger would protest—isn’t analytic of Dasein regulated by norms of absolute intentional meaning?]
HERP.linkedContent: can we read an “unconscious” affinity btwn impending arrival of friend and imminence of death? [Heidegger would protest—isn’t analytic of Dasein regulated by norms of absolute intentional meaning?]

HASD.content: we can read What is Metaphysics? as a treatise on negativity, establishes basis for negative discourse and negation in experience of nothing
HASD.linkedContent: we can read What is Metaphysics? as a treatise on negativity, establishes basis for negative discourse and negation in experience of nothing

HASD.content: strangeness of what is as le tout autre (das schlechthin Andere)—transcendence, which, acc. Heidegger, Plato properly expresses w/ epekeina tes ousias
HASD.linkedContent: strangeness of what is as le tout autre (das schlechthin Andere)—transcendence, which, acc. Heidegger, Plato properly expresses w/ epekeina tes ousias

HASD.content: Heidegger says Plato’s khora fell short of thinking the place (Ort), preparing the way for Cartesian space [Derrida thinks this statement is problematic & reductive]
HASD.linkedContent: Heidegger says Plato’s khora fell short of thinking the place (Ort), preparing the way for Cartesian space [Derrida thinks this statement is problematic & reductive]

HASD.content: but 17 years later, Heidegger says, “[hē khōra] heisst der Ort,” and refers to Plato’s khōrismos as the difference of place (die verschiedene Ortung) btwn Being and beings
HASD.linkedContent: but 17 years later, Heidegger says, “[hē khōra] heisst der Ort,” and refers to Plato’s khōrismos as the difference of place (die verschiedene Ortung) btwn Being and beings

HASD.content: Heidegger: “Christian philosopher is a squared circle”
Heidegger: for Kant, what is becomes an object of representation
HASD.linkedContent: Heidegger: for Kant, what is becomes an object of representation

HASD.content: Heidegger avoids using but not mentioning “Being” [in Zur Seinsfrage]; Heidegger’s kreuzweise Durchstreichung of Being not an erasure w/ avoidance as essential function—a different designation, because Being (which is not [being]) reduces to its turns, turnings, historical tropes (Zuwendungen)
HASD.linkedContent: Heidegger avoids using but not mentioning “Being” [in Zur Seinsfrage]; Heidegger’s kreuzweise Durchstreichung of Being not an erasure w/ avoidance as essential function—a different designation, because Being (which is not [being]) reduces to its turns, turnings, historical tropes (Zuwendungen)

HASD.content: for Heidegger, gathering of Geviert takes place in an indivisible topos, simplicity of point [of sword]: “the place (Ort) gathers toward itself at the greatest height and extremity”
HASD.linkedContent: for Heidegger, gathering of Geviert takes place in an indivisible topos, simplicity of point [of sword]: “the place (Ort) gathers toward itself at the greatest height and extremity”

HASD.content: Derrida remarks on the folds of denial in the conditional mode: if Heidegger were to write a theology
HASD.linkedContent: Derrida remarks on the folds of denial in the conditional mode: if Heidegger were to write a theology

HASD.content: Heidegger privileges, by way of Luther, the revelation of Offenbarkeit, a revelation that occurs in the dimension of Being, over the religious Offenbarung
HASD.linkedContent: Heidegger privileges, by way of Luther, the revelation of Offenbarkeit, a revelation that occurs in the dimension of Being, over the religious Offenbarung

HASD.linkedContent: didn’t Heidegger write a theology of Being, of God? what’s the difference? “he [Heidegger] was not there w/out leaving a trace of all these folds”

HASD.content: Heidegger w/ and w/out word “être” wrote a theology w/ and w/out God, left a trace no longer his own, mais qui reste quasiment la sienne > 3 adverbs: pas, sans, quasiment
HASD.linkedContent: Heidegger w/ and w/out word “être” wrote a theology w/ and w/out God, left a trace no longer his own, mais qui reste quasiment la sienne > 3 adverbs: pas, sans, quasiment

HASD.content: on subject of Ding, Heidegger associates Dionysius w/ Eckhart
HASD.linkedContent: on subject of Ding, Heidegger associates Dionysius w/ Eckhart

MPM.content: Heidegger links law & being in Hölderlin, de Man contests
MPM.linkedContent: Heidegger links law & being in Hölderlin, de Man contests

MPM.content: recognize in figure of phantom the working of what Kant & Heidegger assign to transcendental imagination, “fantastic” temporalizing schemes and powers of synthesis > Kant: an art hidden in depths of soul
MPM.linkedContent: recognize in figure of phantom the working of what Kant & Heidegger assign to transcendental imagination, “fantastic” temporalizing schemes and powers of synthesis > Kant: an art hidden in depths of soul

MPM.content: Heidegger rethinks “thought (Gedanke)” w/ Gedanc, bottom of the heart, gathering together of all that concerns us, more original than Pascal’s thinking of heart?
MPM.linkedContent: Heidegger rethinks “thought (Gedanke)” w/ Gedanc, bottom of the heart, gathering together of all that concerns us, more original than Pascal’s thinking of heart?

MPM.content: via de Man, Heidegger rarely laughs and would probably be against irony as a pose of subjective mastery, never feels the exhilaration of a promise
MPM.linkedContent: via de Man, Heidegger rarely laughs and would probably be against irony as a pose of subjective mastery, never feels the exhilaration of a promise

MPM.content: for Heidegger, thinking of essence of technology is not technology, is free of technicity, same for science [and he would say the same of rhetoric]
MPM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, thinking of essence of technology is not technology, is free of technicity, same for science [and he would say the same of rhetoric]

MPM.content: Socrates is “purest thinker,” did nothing else but place himself in the draft, this is why he wrote nothing
MPM.linkedContent: Socrates is “purest thinker,” did nothing else but place himself in the draft, this is why he wrote nothing

MPM.content: Heidegger: Gedanc [see pp. 140-141], heart, innermost essence of man, reaches outermost limits, the representation of interior/exterior does not arise
MPM.linkedContent: Heidegger: Gedanc [see pp. 140-141], heart, innermost essence of man, reaches outermost limits, the representation of interior/exterior does not arise

MPM.content: Heidegger protects agains abyssal risk of parasitic contamination, of an an-oppositional differance, thus risk and gravity of saying, “essence of technology is not foreign to technology”
MPM.linkedContent: Heidegger protects agains abyssal risk of parasitic contamination, of an an-oppositional differance, thus risk and gravity of saying, “essence of technology is not foreign to technology”

MPM.content: memory w/out anteriority, w/out origin, cannot become a Heideggerian theme
MPM.linkedContent: memory w/out anteriority, w/out origin, cannot become a Heideggerian theme

MPM.content: [re: de Man closer to Heidegger than he thinks] for Heidegger, memory too, like promise, gathers near what can come, toward the “future” > es gibt never gives anything in present, it calls as a promise; Heissen (“to call, ” “to command” > entrust, keep safely)
MPM.linkedContent: [re: de Man closer to Heidegger than he thinks] for Heidegger, memory too, like promise, gathers near what can come, toward the “future” > es gibt never gives anything in present, it calls as a promise; Heissen (“to call, ” “to command” > entrust, keep safely)

MPM.content: for Heidegger, since science doesn’t think, thinking much watch over science, they cannot do so for themselves
MPM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, since science doesn’t think, thinking much watch over science, they cannot do so for themselves

A.content: Heidegger thinks beyond “vulgar concept of time that privileges now,” Derrida asks: “is there anything other than vulgar time & vulgar death” [see OS]
A.linkedContent: Heidegger thinks beyond “vulgar concept of time that privileges now,” Derrida asks: “is there anything other than vulgar time & vulgar death” [see OS]

A.content: Heidegger’s hierarchy, desire to think death properly, division btwn ontic & ontological, imposes pure, rigorous, indivisible borders, borders that are crossed but shouldn't be
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s hierarchy, desire to think death properly, division btwn ontic & ontological, imposes pure, rigorous, indivisible borders, borders that are crossed but shouldn't be

A.content: Heidegger & Kant: man only example of not-man man (Dasein, finite reasonable being)
A.linkedContent: Heidegger & Kant: man only example of not-man man (Dasein, finite reasonable being)

A.content: [Derrida on Heidegger’s incisive decisions and methodology in existential analytic]
A.linkedContent: [Derrida on Heidegger’s incisive decisions and methodology in existential analytic]

A.content: for Heidegger, belief in immortality is secondary to being-toward-death, an affirmation of an originary finitude Hegel thought he reversed in Kant
A.linkedContent: for Heidegger, belief in immortality is secondary to being-toward-death, an affirmation of an originary finitude Hegel thought he reversed in Kant

A.content: Heidegger’s on Kant’s side, on this side of finitude > didn’t Hegel want to show unilaterality of border, and that one is already on the other side of the here?
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s on Kant’s side, on this side of finitude > didn’t Hegel want to show unilaterality of border, and that one is already on the other side of the here?

A.content: Heidegger’s methodologically rigorous choice to start from “this side” [phenomenology] goes hand in hand w/ what prevails, the pré-férance of pre-archic originarity of proper, eigentlich
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s methodologically rigorous choice to start from “this side” [phenomenology] goes hand in hand w/ what prevails, the pré-férance of pre-archic originarity of proper, eigentlich

A.content: Heidegger’s existential analysis has no competence for dealing w/ political problems of burial, cult of the dead
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s existential analysis has no competence for dealing w/ political problems of burial, cult of the dead

A.content: Heidegger refuses to use word universal even though his existential analysis of death wants to be (universal too humanistic for Heidegger, too dependent on Aufklärung)
A.linkedContent: Heidegger refuses to use word universal even though his existential analysis of death wants to be (universal too humanistic for Heidegger, too dependent on Aufklärung)

A.content: irreducible prescriptivity in mode of phenomenological attestation (Bezeugung) > one can and must testify to it
A.linkedContent: irreducible prescriptivity in mode of phenomenological attestation (Bezeugung) > one can and must testify to it

A.content: Heidegger pays no attention to logical form of contradiction (most proper possibility as possibility of an impossibility) > treats it as a condition of truth, its very unveiling (truth no longer measured in logical form of judgment)
A.linkedContent: Heidegger pays no attention to logical form of contradiction (most proper possibility as possibility of an impossibility) > treats it as a condition of truth, its very unveiling (truth no longer measured in logical form of judgment)

A.content: greater and greater orientation toward death, for Heidegger, the incalculable nonmeasure [of truth], signifies possibility of measureless impossibility of existence
A.linkedContent: greater and greater orientation toward death, for Heidegger, the incalculable nonmeasure [of truth], signifies possibility of measureless impossibility of existence

EM.content: let’s not imprison Heidegger’s text in a closure he delimited better than anyone
EM.linkedContent: let’s not imprison Heidegger’s text in a closure he delimited better than anyone

EM.content: if we give up we-men (nous-hommes) in relation to metaphysical determinations (i.e. zōon logon ekhon, etc.), the proper of man remains inseparable from the question or truth of Being (this makes Heidegger’s Kehre even less pertinent)
EM.linkedContent: if we give up we-men (nous-hommes) in relation to metaphysical determinations (i.e. zōon logon ekhon, etc.), the proper of man remains inseparable from the question or truth of Being (this makes Heidegger’s Kehre even less pertinent)

EM.content: reading of text Dasein is a hermeneutics > if one looks closely, phenomenological opposition “implicit/explicit” permits Heidegger to avoid vicious circle (posing question of Being on basis of ontological predetermination)
EM.linkedContent: reading of text Dasein is a hermeneutics > if one looks closely, phenomenological opposition “implicit/explicit” permits Heidegger to avoid vicious circle (posing question of Being on basis of ontological predetermination)

EM.content: for Heidegger, motif of proximity caught in opposition which unceasingly regulates his discourse: in proximity of ontic, ontological Dasein is that which is farthest
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, motif of proximity caught in opposition which unceasingly regulates his discourse: in proximity of ontic, ontological Dasein is that which is farthest

EM.content: (152-53) before/after Heidegger’s Kehre > space of proximity and distance to Being
EM.linkedContent: (152-53) before/after Heidegger’s Kehre > space of proximity and distance to Being

EM.content: Heidegger’s radical questions re: humanism, his study of genesis of concept/value of “man” via Greek paideai in Rome, Christianizing of Latin humanitas, rebirth of Hellenism in 14th-18th centuries, makes secondary any metahumanist position not placed in his opening
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger’s radical questions re: humanism, his study of genesis of concept/value of “man” via Greek paideai in Rome, Christianizing of Latin humanitas, rebirth of Hellenism in 14th-18th centuries, makes secondary any metahumanist position not placed in his opening

EM.content: if Heidegger has radically deconstructed domination of metaphysics by the present, by leading us to think presence of the present, this thinking can only be metaphorized, and can’t simply decide to escape a profound necessity, language it deconstructs
EM.linkedContent: if Heidegger has radically deconstructed domination of metaphysics by the present, by leading us to think presence of the present, this thinking can only be metaphorized, and can’t simply decide to escape a profound necessity, language it deconstructs

EM.content: Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being), “an alternative always suspended over its ‘own proper’ abysm”: it is the text of dissemination
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being), “an alternative always suspended over its ‘own proper’ abysm”: it is the text of dissemination

EM.content: Derrida on privilege of spoken language in Heidegger [I’ll study it elsewhere?] leads back to Being as presence, Anwesenheit > but, is also erased when Heidegger announces a Wesen that wouldn’t be Anwesen (see OS [?])
EM.linkedContent: Derrida on privilege of spoken language in Heidegger [I’ll study it elsewhere?] leads back to Being as presence, Anwesenheit > but, is also erased when Heidegger announces a Wesen that wouldn’t be Anwesen (see OS [?])

EM.content: Heidegger: written form exerts wholesome pressure, present world crisis needs less philosophy, more thinking, less literature, we must liberate Dichtung from literature [?]
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger: written form exerts wholesome pressure, present world crisis needs less philosophy, more thinking, less literature, we must liberate Dichtung from literature [?]

EM.content: is Nietzsche the last metaphysician as Heidegger reads him? or is Heidegger the last sleeping shudder (le dernier sursaut ensommeillé) of the higher man?
EM.linkedContent: is Nietzsche the last metaphysician as Heidegger reads him? or is Heidegger the last sleeping shudder (le dernier sursaut ensommeillé) of the higher man?

VM.content: appeal to tradition found in Husserl’s phenomenology and Heidegger’s “ontology”: 1) entirety of philosophy has a Greek source 2) a reduction of metaphysics 3) the ethical loses its metaphysical specificity, coordinated with something other than itself
VM.linkedContent: appeal to tradition found in Husserl’s phenomenology and Heidegger’s “ontology”: 1) entirety of philosophy has a Greek source 2) a reduction of metaphysics 3) the ethical loses its metaphysical specificity, coordinated with something other than itself

VM.content: Heidegger, according to Levinas, adds historicity to Husserl
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger, according to Levinas, adds historicity to Husserl

VM.content: Heidegger allows Hegel’s discourse to grow and speak (Hegel’s discourse as that of all metaphysics)
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger allows Hegel’s discourse to grow and speak (Hegel’s discourse as that of all metaphysics)

VM.content: w/ “epochs,” being-history, Heidegger permits reemergence of thought of eschatology: “Being itself…is in itself eschatological”; eschatology different from messianic eschatology in that w/ former war is not an accident that overcomes Being, war not even negative, war is Being itself
VM.linkedContent: w/ “epochs,” being-history, Heidegger permits reemergence of thought of eschatology: “Being itself…is in itself eschatological”; eschatology different from messianic eschatology in that w/ former war is not an accident that overcomes Being, war not even negative, war is Being itself

VM.content: Heidegger stops using Endlichkeit, it was never Christian-theological but idea of finite Being is ontotheological
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger stops using Endlichkeit, it was never Christian-theological but idea of finite Being is ontotheological

VM.content: thought that seeks to go to its very end in its language, the end envisaged under name of finitude, should abandon words & themes of finite/infinite & everything they govern > this is the impossible of beyond metaphysics which confirms necessity for this incommensurable overflow to take support from metaphysics
VM.linkedContent: thought that seeks to go to its very end in its language, the end envisaged under name of finitude, should abandon words & themes of finite/infinite & everything they govern > this is the impossible of beyond metaphysics which confirms necessity for this incommensurable overflow to take support from metaphysics

VM.content: Heidegger realized this in making difference [btwn Being & existent] fundamental
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger realized this in making difference [btwn Being & existent] fundamental

S.content: Heidegger warns we should, he should, vermeiden (avoid, flee) the word “spirit”
S.linkedContent: Heidegger warns we should, he should, vermeiden (avoid, flee) the word “spirit”

S.content: Heidegger would have to close up thinking-shop if called by the faith
S.linkedContent: Heidegger would have to close up thinking-shop if called by the faith

S.content: Heidegger’s discourse [on hand], all the more peremptory and authoritarian for hiding its discomfiture, preserves, sheltered in obscurity, the profoundest metaphysical humanism
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s discourse [on hand], all the more peremptory and authoritarian for hiding its discomfiture, preserves, sheltered in obscurity, the profoundest metaphysical humanism

S.content: geopolitics is a Weltpolitik of spirit, world is not earth, earth obscures the world, preeminence of mediocre, massification of man, destruction of earth
S.linkedContent: geopolitics is a Weltpolitik of spirit, world is not earth, earth obscures the world, preeminence of mediocre, massification of man, destruction of earth

S.content: Heidegger’s absolute limit btwn man and animal distances itself from biologism, philosophy of life, politics, and Rilke—and Nietzsche too
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s absolute limit btwn man and animal distances itself from biologism, philosophy of life, politics, and Rilke—and Nietzsche too

S.content: Heidegger’s destitution of spirit is not a crisis of spirit: crisis, acc. Derrida, would perhaps be treated by Heidegger as a symptom of Cartesian heritage
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s destitution of spirit is not a crisis of spirit: crisis, acc. Derrida, would perhaps be treated by Heidegger as a symptom of Cartesian heritage

S.content: Derrida finds Heidegger “horribly dangerous (terriblement dangereux)” and “wildly funny (follement drôle)” in his irrefutable, strange paradoxy [his tautologies?]
S.linkedContent: Derrida finds Heidegger “horribly dangerous (terriblement dangereux)” and “wildly funny (follement drôle)” in his irrefutable, strange paradoxy [his tautologies?]

S.content: in Der Spiegel interview, Heidegger: when they begin to think, the French speak German
S.linkedContent: in Der Spiegel interview, Heidegger: when they begin to think, the French speak German

S.content: Heidegger saves Nietzsche’s text (from accusation of biologism, zoologism, racism [?]) by damning it: still metaphysics of absolute subjectity like Hegel: Nietzsche’s absolute subjectity that of body, impulsions, affects; Hegel’s that of the willing that knows itself
S.linkedContent: Heidegger saves Nietzsche’s text (from accusation of biologism, zoologism, racism [?]) by damning it: still metaphysics of absolute subjectity like Hegel: Nietzsche’s absolute subjectity that of body, impulsions, affects; Hegel’s that of the willing that knows itself

S.content: Heidegger’s Kehre? from question to Zusage?: remove remnant of Aufklärung which still slumbered in privilege of the question? [Derrida is not having it]
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Kehre? from question to Zusage?: remove remnant of Aufklärung which still slumbered in privilege of the question? [Derrida is not having it]

S.content: Derrida avoids emphasizing a Kehre from Fragen to Zusage (the gage) in Heidegger by talking about a stratigraphy, a number of stratas that become visible, scarcely visible in Heidegger’s thought, so that resolution (Entschlossenheit), appeal (Rufsinn), original trustworthiness (Verlässlichkeit) are already there before “the turn”
S.linkedContent: Derrida avoids emphasizing a Kehre from Fragen to Zusage (the gage) in Heidegger by talking about a stratigraphy, a number of stratas that become visible, scarcely visible in Heidegger’s thought, so that resolution (Entschlossenheit), appeal (Rufsinn), original trustworthiness (Verlässlichkeit) are already there before “the turn”

FWT.content: Heidegger’s Destruktion has Lutheran origins which Derrida has always been interested in deconstructing, but can one pass through, overstep, this “Christian” landscape?
FWT.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Destruktion has Lutheran origins which Derrida has always been interested in deconstructing, but can one pass through, overstep, this “Christian” landscape?

OS.content: Heidegger designates milieu of self-evidence, outside which thought suffocates > has not entire philosophy been authorized on “extraordinary right” of present? for Heidegger, it’s not a question of thinking otherwise, it’s thinking that which could not have been, nor thought, otherwise ——the impossibility of the otherwise produces a trembling, a question of tout autre, think the tie btwn truth/presence, in a thought that doesn’t need to be true/present [no skeptical moment]
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger designates milieu of self-evidence, outside which thought suffocates > has not entire philosophy been authorized on “extraordinary right” of present? for Heidegger, it’s not a question of thinking otherwise, it’s thinking that which could not have been, nor thought, otherwise ——the impossibility of the otherwise produces a trembling, a question of tout autre, think the tie btwn truth/presence, in a thought that doesn’t need to be true/present [no skeptical moment]

OS.content: Heidegger often considered Hegel to have covered over Kant’s audaciousness, though…
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger often considered Hegel to have covered over Kant’s audaciousness, though…

OS.content: Heidegger: Kant’s transcendental aesthetic can’t perceive something actually present (Anwesenden), to perceive something Gegenwärtigen, one couldn’t intuit a single now (Jetzt), since each now has essentially continuous extension in just passing and just coming (in sein Soeben und Sogleich)
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger: Kant’s transcendental aesthetic can’t perceive something actually present (Anwesenden), to perceive something Gegenwärtigen, one couldn’t intuit a single now (Jetzt), since each now has essentially continuous extension in just passing and just coming (in sein Soeben und Sogleich)

OS.content: opening of Heideggerian breakthrough (percée): thought the excess of metaphysics
OS.linkedContent: opening of Heideggerian breakthrough (percée): thought the excess of metaphysics

POS.content: Derrida is “above all” made possible by Heidegger’s ontological difference (the unthought difference btwn Being and beings), yet Nietzsche is “perhaps” a move beyond the ontotheology of Heidegger, toward a differance no longer in language of West
POS.linkedContent: Derrida is “above all” made possible by Heidegger’s ontological difference (the unthought difference btwn Being and beings), yet Nietzsche is “perhaps” a move beyond the ontotheology of Heidegger, toward a differance no longer in language of West

POS.content: Heidegger recognized that economically/strategically he had to borrow language of metaphysics, as one always must do at moment one deconstructs this language
POS.linkedContent: Heidegger recognized that economically/strategically he had to borrow language of metaphysics, as one always must do at moment one deconstructs this language

POS.content: Heidegger’s phonologism, privileging of poem over literature
POS.linkedContent: Heidegger’s phonologism, privileging of poem over literature

ROP.content: finitude is derived for Kant, while it is originary for Heidegger
ROP.linkedContent: finitude is derived for Kant, while it is originary for Heidegger

SP.content: Heidegger’s 3 warnings on reading Nietzsche: 1.	simply aestheticizing his work as philosopher-artist would corroborate current order of philosophy 2.	do not confuse “heroic-boastful” style (pseudo-transgressive exuberance) for “grand style” 3.	must read Nietzsche as unremitting interrogation of Western civilization
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s 3 warnings on reading Nietzsche: 1. simply aestheticizing his work as philosopher-artist would corroborate current order of philosophy 2. do not confuse “heroic-boastful” style (pseudo-transgressive exuberance) for “grand style” 3. must read Nietzsche as unremitting interrogation of Western civilization

SP.content: Heidegger’s 3 propositions related to these warnings: 1. there’s only been a philosopher before art, a gossiping woman, a sterile woman (not a männliche Mutter); acc. Nietzsche, the old aesthetic nothing but that of passive, receptive consumers 2. Nietzsche’s art would be “metaphysical in its most intimate intention” 3. Nietzsche deals (most frequently) w/ Plato by simple inversion (Umdrehung), standing Platonic propositions on their head
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s 3 propositions related to these warnings: 1. there’s only been a philosopher before art, a gossiping woman, a sterile woman (not a männliche Mutter); acc. Nietzsche, the old aesthetic nothing but that of passive, receptive consumers 2. Nietzsche’s art would be “metaphysical in its most intimate intention” 3. Nietzsche deals (most frequently) w/ Plato by simple inversion (Umdrehung), standing Platonic propositions on their head

SP.content: Heidegger oscillates btwn reading in Nietzsche a simple Umdrehung (inversion) of Plato or something other > neither a direct flipping, nor an an-archical erasure of hierarchy (which consolidates established order), but “a transformation of hierarchical structure itself”
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger oscillates btwn reading in Nietzsche a simple Umdrehung (inversion) of Plato or something other > neither a direct flipping, nor an an-archical erasure of hierarchy (which consolidates established order), but “a transformation of hierarchical structure itself”

ATIA.content: Lacan and Heidegger both think animals can’t die [cf. p. 154 Heidegger implies animal unique from rock because of possibility of dying (sterben)]
ATIA.linkedContent: Lacan and Heidegger both think animals can’t die [cf. p. 154 Heidegger implies animal unique from rock because of possibility of dying (sterben)]

DIF.content: before Heidegger purposely and radically questioned presence, Freud & Nietzsche did so, and, remarkably, they did so via motif of differance [remarkable :)]
DIF.linkedContent: before Heidegger purposely and radically questioned presence, Freud & Nietzsche did so, and, remarkably, they did so via motif of differance [remarkable :)]

DIF.content: Heidegger: usage (Brauch) has left a trace (Spur) in to khreon (necessity), quickly forgotten in destiny of Being, usage conjoins the dis- (Der Brauch fügt das Un-) > doesn’t dis of differance refer us beyond history of Being, beyond our language, beyond anything that can be named in it?
DIF.linkedContent: Heidegger: usage (Brauch) has left a trace (Spur) in to khreon (necessity), quickly forgotten in destiny of Being, usage conjoins the dis- (Der Brauch fügt das Un-) > doesn’t dis of differance refer us beyond history of Being, beyond our language, beyond anything that can be named in it?

DPi.content: “deconstruction” of Christianity is very business of Christianity; no doubt Heidegger inherited Destruktion from Lutherian destructio
DPi.linkedContent: “deconstruction” of Christianity is very business of Christianity; no doubt Heidegger inherited Destruktion from Lutherian destructio

Gi.content: the trace of Heidegger’s silence on sexuality doesn’t come from just anywhere, but Derrida won’t pin it down w/ a name (omission, foreclosure, unthought, repression, denial)
Gi.linkedContent: the trace of Heidegger’s silence on sexuality doesn’t come from just anywhere, but Derrida won’t pin it down w/ a name (omission, foreclosure, unthought, repression, denial)

Gi.content: isn’t Heidegger repeating traditional philosophemes w/ new rigor, beginning w/ a neutralization, denying a negativity?
Gi.linkedContent: isn’t Heidegger repeating traditional philosophemes w/ new rigor, beginning w/ a neutralization, denying a negativity?

Gi.content: Heidegger, by going back “further,” higher > avoids religion, ethical, even dialectical schemas
Gi.linkedContent: Heidegger, by going back “further,” higher > avoids religion, ethical, even dialectical schemas

Gii.content: speak of Heidegger, speak of monstrosity
Heidegger’s question of technology presented as protest, barely disguised condemnation of professionalization of University studies during Nazi regime
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s question of technology presented as protest, barely disguised condemnation of professionalization of University studies during Nazi regime

Gii.content: Heidegger employs idiomatic untranslatability of opposition btwn geistig/geistlich to withdraw Gedicht (“site”) of Trakl from Platonic tradition, w/ its opposition aisthēton/noeton (“sensible” material/“intelligible” spirituality), and from Christian opposition spiritual/temporal
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger employs idiomatic untranslatability of opposition btwn geistig/geistlich to withdraw Gedicht (“site”) of Trakl from Platonic tradition, w/ its opposition aisthēton/noeton (“sensible” material/“intelligible” spirituality), and from Christian opposition spiritual/temporal

Gii.content: savage second blow of sexual difference, its Verwesung, vs. originary, tender sexual difference > Heidegger claims this schema is not Christian/Platonic, but it has no other content and even no other language than Platonism/Christianity > its archi-matinal origin, ultra-Western horizon, constituted by hollow of a repetition, same for Verfall, Ruf, Sorge in structure of Dasein
Gii.linkedContent: savage second blow of sexual difference, its Verwesung, vs. originary, tender sexual difference > Heidegger claims this schema is not Christian/Platonic, but it has no other content and even no other language than Platonism/Christianity > its archi-matinal origin, ultra-Western horizon, constituted by hollow of a repetition, same for Verfall, Ruf, Sorge in structure of Dasein

REST.content: Heidegger’s Origin of the Work of Art, belongs to great discourse on place & truth
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Origin of the Work of Art, belongs to great discourse on place & truth

REST.content: praise for Heidegger’s Es gibt, Sein starting from (returning to) Es gibt Sein
REST.linkedContent: praise for Heidegger’s Es gibt, Sein starting from (returning to) Es gibt Sein

REST.content: Heidegger’s Origin of the Work of Art intends to lead beyond, or to, eve of constitution of the subjectum, a Schritt zurück (backward step) on road of thought [?]
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Origin of the Work of Art intends to lead beyond, or to, eve of constitution of the subjectum, a Schritt zurück (backward step) on road of thought [?]

REST.content: Derrida imagines a gallery filled w/ all the female examples (figures) Heidegger uses
REST.linkedContent: Derrida imagines a gallery filled w/ all the female examples (figures) Heidegger uses

REST.content: Verlässlichkeit > reliability anterior to any nameable subject (commitment), that which is verlässig deserves faith/credit/confidence
REST.linkedContent: Verlässlichkeit > reliability anterior to any nameable subject (commitment), that which is verlässig deserves faith/credit/confidence

DST.content: for Lacoue-Labarthe, Heidegger succumbs to mimetology by refusing to take mimesis seriously
DST.linkedContent: for Lacoue-Labarthe, Heidegger succumbs to mimetology by refusing to take mimesis seriously

DST.content: Derrida has his doubts when Lacoue-Labarthe argues that Heidegger’s unthought (impensé) gathers in unity of single site, as if there were only one unthought for each “great” thought—as its secret law
DST.linkedContent: Derrida has his doubts when Lacoue-Labarthe argues that Heidegger’s unthought (impensé) gathers in unity of single site, as if there were only one unthought for each “great” thought—as its secret law

WAP.content: how can you not burst out laughing before photo of Heidegger in shorts
WAP.linkedContent: how can you not burst out laughing before photo of Heidegger in shorts

IW.content: Rosenzweig speaks of Cohen breaking free from Hegel (by returning to Kant): math [which guides Cohen here] generates its elements not from empty nothing of 1 and universal 0, but determinate nothing of differential, a particular nothing [Derrida adds: Heidegger too]
IW.linkedContent: Rosenzweig speaks of Cohen breaking free from Hegel (by returning to Kant): math [which guides Cohen here] generates its elements not from empty nothing of 1 and universal 0, but determinate nothing of differential, a particular nothing [Derrida adds: Heidegger too]

EL.content: Heidegger attempted to think a non-Platonic, non-Christian “worldhood”
EL.linkedContent: Heidegger attempted to think a non-Platonic, non-Christian “worldhood”

BSi.content: Unheimlichkeit just as important for Heidegger as for Freud (but scarcely pointed out)
BSi.linkedContent: Unheimlichkeit just as important for Heidegger as for Freud (but scarcely pointed out)

BSi.content: for Heidegger, in the questioning essence of man, man comes to himself as “who” not “what” (ipseity [Selbst] before any “I,” individual, we or community)
BSi.linkedContent: for Heidegger, in the questioning essence of man, man comes to himself as “who” not “what” (ipseity [Selbst] before any “I,” individual, we or community)

BSi.content: for Heidegger, the object is Vorhandensein—the dead body of living being (animal or man) is neither Dasein, nor Zu-, nor Vor-handensein [?]
BSi.linkedContent: for Heidegger, the object is Vorhandensein—the dead body of living being (animal or man) is neither Dasein, nor Zu-, nor Vor-handensein [?]

BSi.content: Derrida speaks of Heidegger’s arrogant, smug condescension [still, Derrida likes it?]
BSi.linkedContent: Derrida speaks of Heidegger’s arrogant, smug condescension [still, Derrida likes it?]

BSi.content: Heidegger’s stubborn stupidity: only man has a relation to dying (sterben) as such
BSi.linkedContent: Heidegger’s stubborn stupidity: only man has a relation to dying (sterben) as such

BSi.content: Heidegger against strict, conventional division of man/animal [for very different reasons than Derrida], doesn’t make man unique enough
BSi.linkedContent: Heidegger against strict, conventional division of man/animal [for very different reasons than Derrida], doesn’t make man unique enough

BSi.content: Heidegger’s critique of biologism, i.e. biopoliticism: ek-sistence not simply a specific kind of living creature
BSi.linkedContent: Heidegger’s critique of biologism, i.e. biopoliticism: ek-sistence not simply a specific kind of living creature

OG.content: Heidegger’s reading of Nietzschean demolition irrefutable if it remains confined to metaphysical edifice, entirely other if one accepts the deconstruction at hand > is Nietzsche captive or deconstructive?
OG.linkedContent: Heidegger’s reading of Nietzschean demolition irrefutable if it remains confined to metaphysical edifice, entirely other if one accepts the deconstruction at hand > is Nietzsche captive or deconstructive?

OG.content: the (transcendental) word “being” as Urwort (mot originaire) ensures “l’être-mot” to all other words [Lacan’s name-of-the-father], but “being” not reduced to word or concept: 1) modern linguistics doesn’t have to do w/ [Heideggerian] “language” 2) question of being [Seinsfrage] enclosed (unknowingly) in old linguistics of word
OG.linkedContent: the (transcendental) word “being” as Urwort (mot originaire) ensures “l’être-mot” to all other words [Lacan’s name-of-the-father], but “being” not reduced to word or concept: 1) modern linguistics doesn’t have to do w/ [Heideggerian] “language” 2) question of being [Seinsfrage] enclosed (unknowingly) in old linguistics of word

OG.content: does Heidegger transgress logocentrism of phonè by questioning being? or does the question precomprehend the word being? deconstructive breakthrough (percée) no longer circumscribed in ontic/ontological [?]
OG.linkedContent: does Heidegger transgress logocentrism of phonè by questioning being? or does the question precomprehend the word being? deconstructive breakthrough (percée) no longer circumscribed in ontic/ontological [?]

OG.content: Heidegger transgresses and contained (y est comprise) at same time in presence of logocentrism > his crossing-out (rature, kreuzweise Durchstreichung) of Being effaces presence of transcendental signified while keeping it legible: this last writing is a first writing (of an epoch), inasmuch as it de-limits onto-theology, metaphysics of presence, logocentrism > Heidegger must restore (provisionally) “transcendence” to Being to renounce project/word ontology [given risk of transgression becoming regression here, Derrida insists we go by way of Heidegger’s rigor alone]
OG.linkedContent: Heidegger transgresses and contained (y est comprise) at same time in presence of logocentrism > his crossing-out (rature, kreuzweise Durchstreichung) of Being effaces presence of transcendental signified while keeping it legible: this last writing is a first writing (of an epoch), inasmuch as it de-limits onto-theology, metaphysics of presence, logocentrism > Heidegger must restore (provisionally) “transcendence” to Being to renounce project/word ontology [given risk of transgression becoming regression here, Derrida insists we go by way of Heidegger’s rigor alone]

OG.content: Heidegger questions privilege of “infinitive” and “3rd person singular of the present indicative” [to be, is]
OG.linkedContent: Heidegger questions privilege of “infinitive” and “3rd person singular of the present indicative” [to be, is]

OG.content: the hesitation of Heidegger & Nietzsche is not “incoherence,” it is the trembling of deconstruction: deconstruction does not destroy structures from the inside, must inhabit, inhabits most when one doesn’t suspect it > borrow all subversive strategies from old structure
OG.linkedContent: the hesitation of Heidegger & Nietzsche is not “incoherence,” it is the trembling of deconstruction: deconstruction does not destroy structures from the inside, must inhabit, inhabits most when one doesn’t suspect it > borrow all subversive strategies from old structure

EU.content: Heidegger’s move beyond responsibility for a determinate knowledge or power: must first answer to being, for the call of being—must think this coresponsibility
EU.linkedContent: Heidegger’s move beyond responsibility for a determinate knowledge or power: must first answer to being, for the call of being—must think this coresponsibility

EU.content: thought of sendoff (envoi), dispensation or gift of being: one of most powerful/singular attempts to think history/structure of onto-theology: Shickung, Schicksal, Gabe, “es gibt Sein,” “es gibt Zeit” do not seem to belong w/in onto-theological philosophemes
EU.linkedContent: thought of sendoff (envoi), dispensation or gift of being: one of most powerful/singular attempts to think history/structure of onto-theology: Shickung, Schicksal, Gabe, “es gibt Sein,” “es gibt Zeit” do not seem to belong w/in onto-theological philosophemes

EU.content: [Derrida offers an example of what “fundamental” research of Heidegger might look like]
EU.linkedContent: [Derrida offers an example of what “fundamental” research of Heidegger might look like]

FV.content: Lacan reconstitutes Cartesian certainty, capturing in this chain (Descartes–Hegel–Husserl) Heideggerian motions which are allergic to it—rigorously speaking
FV.linkedContent: Lacan reconstitutes Cartesian certainty, capturing in this chain (Descartes–Hegel–Husserl) Heideggerian motions which are allergic to it—rigorously speaking

FV.content: full speech, contracts only w/ itself, system of truth > Lacan not proposing crude readjustment [i.e. American psychology] but rarity à la Heideggerian Eigentlichkeit
FV.linkedContent: full speech, contracts only w/ itself, system of truth > Lacan not proposing crude readjustment [i.e. American psychology] but rarity à la Heideggerian Eigentlichkeit

FV.content: by way of Lacan, Freud tells us very literally Heidegger’s What is Metaphysics?
FV.linkedContent: by way of Lacan, Freud tells us very literally Heidegger’s What is Metaphysics?

CHOR.content: I am going too quickly, I’m schematizing excessively: Heidegger begins by denying all forms of security, all sedimented presuppositions of classical ontology
CHOR.linkedContent: I am going too quickly, I’m schematizing excessively: Heidegger begins by denying all forms of security, all sedimented presuppositions of classical ontology
